name: TYPHOID VACCINE
cautions:
Cautions section 14.1; interactions: see above and Appendix

name: TYPHOID VACCINE Typhoid polysaccharide vaccine for injection
cautions:
Cautions section 14.1; interactions: see above and Appendix
1 (typhoid vaccine (oral) )
doses:
Name[Typhim Vi® (Sanofi Pasteur) ] Injection, Vi capsular polysaccharide
typhoid vaccine, 50 micrograms/mL virulence polysaccharide antigen
of formaldehyde-inactivated Salmonella typhi,
net price 0.5-mL prefilled syringe = £9.30Dose by intramuscular injection, 0.5 mL, at
least 2 weeks before potential exposure to typhoid infection child under 2 years (see notes above)

name: TYPHOID VACCINE Typhoid vaccine, live (oral)
cautions:
Cautions section 14.1; interactions: see above and Appendix
1 (typhoid vaccine (oral) )
doses:
Name[Vivotif® (Crucell) ] Capsules, e/c, live attenuated Salmonella typhi (Ty21a), net price 3-cap pack = £14.77. 
    Label:
    25, counselling, administrationDose adult and child over 6 years, 1 capsule on days 1, 3, and 5Counselling Take one hour before a meal. Swallow
as soon as possible after placing in mouth with a cold or lukewarm
drink; it is important to store capsules in a refrigerator
